law.catch_line: This section applies to an individual who is an owner operator of:...

section.section:
This section applies to an individual who is an owner operator of:
a Class F (tractor) vehicle, as described in § 13-923 of the Transportation Article; or
except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, a Class E (truck) vehicle, as described in § 13-916 of the Transportation Article, including a Class E (truck) vehicle described in § 13-919 of the Transportation Article.
This section does not apply to the owner operator of a vehicle registered as a Class T vehicle under § 13-920 of the Transportation Article.

text.section:
An individual who is an owner operator is not a covered employee if:
the individual and motor carrier make a written agreement for permanent or trip leasing;
under the agreement:
there is no intent to create an employer-employee relationship; and
the individual is paid rental compensation; and
for federal tax purposes, the individual qualifies as an independent contractor.

section.section: A motor carrier who enters into an agreement under subsection (b) of this section is considered a principal contractor under § 9-508 of this title.

An individual who is an owner operator and enters into an agreement under subsection (b) of this section is:
considered a subcontractor under § 9-508 of this title;
for purposes of being a subcontractor, not considered a covered employee of the entity that the individual operator owns; and
not entitled to compensation from a principal contractor under § 9-508 of this title.

text.section: An individual who is an owner operator and enters into a written agreement under subsection (b) of this section shall provide proof of insurance for any covered employee of the individual as may be required by this title.
